title: [Large-scale] CPS Reliability Assessment and Intelligent Control Strategy Development Project

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational control systems theory, understanding of machine learning concepts, and basic network security knowledge
context.additional_context: Learners are organized into 6-8 member teams to analyze CPS models simulating real industrial environments and develop reliability evaluation frameworks. Real-time data processing and simulation are enabled via digital devices (tablets/laptops) and analytical tools.

learning_goals: Five or more CPS reliability evaluation metrics can be identified and an explainable model can be constructed
System reliability changes can be predicted within 15% accuracy using a machine learning-based real-time ranking algorithm
A distributed collaborative control strategy can be designed for attack-defense scenarios and defense resource allocation can be optimized by over 20%
A composite reliability assessment framework can be proposed using a spatiotemporal correlation model
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
